article: How to Make a Partial Payment with a Visa Gift Card

points.name: Paying Partially with a Visa Gift Card Online

steps.title: Contact customer support for the online store.
steps.subtitle: If you still can’t get your Visa gift card partial payment to work, contact customer service of the store you’re trying to purchase from. Call the number listed on the “Contact Us” or “Help Center” page.
sub-points: Explain your situation to the customer service representative—they may be able to help you make the partial purchase with your Visa gift card or eGift card.

steps.title: Place your Amazon order.Place your order
steps.subtitle: Once your payment details are complete, double-check all of your order details. Make sure the charged amounts on each card are correct, along with your shipping address, billing address, and the items in your cart. When you’re done, select .
sub-points: After your order is confirmed, you’ll receive an order confirmation to the email address associated with your Amazon account.
This email will include the payment method(s) you used for your purchase.

points.name: Combining Visa Gift Cards on Amazon

steps.title: Use your saved Visa gift cards like any payment method on Amazon.Proceed to Checkout
steps.subtitle: Select the items you want to purchase on Amazon and add them to your shopping cart. Click on the shopping cart icon and then click . Log in to your Amazon account, if prompted, and provide the requested shipping information from your order.
sub-points: In the payment section of the checkout process, select one of your Visa gift cards as your payment method.
Enter the amount of money you want to use from the gift card. Then, select the other saved Visa gift card to cover the remaining balance.
Re-confirm your order details and click .

points.name: Visa Gift Cards vs. Regular Gift Cards

steps.title: Visa gift cards are treated as bank cards, not as store gift cards.
steps.subtitle: There is generally no space on a payment method page to enter both a Visa gift card and a bank card as separate payment methods. Visa cards must be entered in the same place that a debit or credit card would be entered.
sub-points: Store gift cards are “closed loop” cards, meaning that they can only be used in one place. On the other hand, Visa gift cards and bank cards are both “open loop” cards that can be used at practically any store.
For this reason, online stores will usually not allow you to pay with  a bank card and Visa gift card in one transaction.
When , your transaction will typically decline if your Visa gift card balance is lower than the dollar value of your online purchase.

points.name: Pros & Cons of Using Visa Gift Cards Online

steps.title: Cons: No overdraft protections or reloading
steps.subtitle: With a Visa gift card, you can only spend exactly the amount loaded on the card. There’s no overdraft protection if you spend too much, which you do get with most debit or credit cards.
sub-points: The prepaid cards also can’t be reloaded—once they’ve been used up, Visa gift cards can’t be used again.
Visa gift cards also expire and may deduct fees if they go months without being used.
